intro: Anisocalyx salarius, commonly known as the lesser anisocalyx, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its opposite, elliptical leaves and small, clustered white to pinkish flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests or along stream banks. The fruit is a small, fleshy drupe that contains one or two seeds.
